name: Aloft Dallas Downtown

reviews.text: It definitely caters to a younger 20-30's demographic, the decor and room furniture is distinctly dormitory feeling, BUT the rooms were ginormous. Given the size of the room, the bathroom was a little on the small side, but nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a fun hotel that's on the youthful trendy side, this is a good choice. There is not a lot of night life in the immediate vicinity so be prepared to drive somewhere else, but the ride will not be too long.
reviews.title: Surprisingly pleased, would definitely recommend.

reviews.text: One week spent at this hotel for a conference in Dallas.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: Great location for downtown. Beautiful hotel and impressive rooms. Large rooms with lots of space. Ambiance of the hotel is very modern and chic. The lobby feels more like a club or a bar than a hotel lobby.
reviews.title: Industrial and funky

reviews.text: Hotel staff are exceptional! The best. There is no restaurant but you can order food from the bar. Food is also available at the snack area 24 hours a day.
reviews.title: Beautiful, modern hotel... would love to stay again.
Left Electronic Toothbrush - and now it's MIA
reviews.text: I would enjoy staying here again on another trip to Dallas.

I stayed at this hotel for a business meeting (also held there) and was underwhelmed. Seemed like a cool concept, but in practice that's all it was - a cool concept. My room was very clean (always important!) and very minimalistic as far as decor, which was fine. But that's where the praise ends. It was very dark and half the lights didn't work. It was pretty small and in fact the shower was set up so that you could see the person showering from the main room (some sort of weird glass, rather than a wall, connecting them). One of the blinds was totally broken, making it darker. The lights above the bed didn't function, the toilet ran constantly and there was a sound like being in the middle of an airplane hanger. The wakeup calls came late and no one called to check when one day I didn't answer (I was already in the shower). They didn't bring me any new towels (even though I made it clear that I needed them). The cordless phone was out of batteries. So all in all, my feeling was the room was poorly maintained from anything other than a cleaning standpoint.
reviews.title: Clean and that's about it

reviews.text: Oh - and booking for this hotel was incredibly difficult - the people I spoke with on the phone were completely incompetent. They didn't know what the conference was that I was referring to. Yes they did! They were out of rooms for the conference two months out. No they weren't - they had plenty of rooms! They couldn't find my reservation (I was on hold for 45 mins). They found it! They lost my reservation. They found it again! In the end, the company sponsoring the conference booked my room - I could no longer deal.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location!

reviews.text: Then when I tried to get an online receipt for the room (to do my expense report) they said it would take a week to send it. Then, when a week went by and I didn't get it, someone else managed to send it in two minutes.
reviews.title: Superb!
Hippest Hotspot in the "Big D" and a great place to re-connect with my Tri-Delta Sisters!
reviews.text: The location isn't great either. They do have good wasabi almonds at the bar though.
Great, modern and a bit funky hotel!! Loved the stay. Comfortable beds, great linens! Amazing staff!! Will definitely be back!!!
reviews.title: We had a great time, worth every penny!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving they told me they changed my reservation to a suite without explanation and I was not going to argue, who would? I loved the room, very modern and comfortable at the same time. The location was great and although parking is $8/night I didn't mind. Most hotels charge much more for parking now so $8 was totally fine with me. I liked the casual ease of this hotel. The best part was how quiet the room was, I slept really well (which isn't typical for a hotel). This is now my hotel of choice in Dallas!
reviews.title: This is now my hotel of choice in Dallas

reviews.text: i had never stayed in Aloft before, so didn't know what to expect. Kind of weird walking into a hotel lobby with the noise blasting at you. Ceiling about 25" tall. Easy check in. Accommodated a change in type of room that I wanted. They put me on the second floor, right above the bar area. I was leery of being able to sleep, but didn't hear a thing. I couldn't believe it. The rooms are spacious. The room has indirect lighting. Strange configuration. Either all the lights are on, or all the lights are off, except for one over the shower. So if someone gets up in the middle of the night and wants to turn the bathroom light on, the switch turns them all on. There were no drinking glasses. And only one regular coffee set up and one decaf. So if two of you are there, someone gets decaf. And you can only make one cup at a time anyway. The beds are not Sheraton standard, not quite as comfortable. There is a half-ironing board, not full size. And the room has a fridge, but no microwave. Also, they don't have vending or ice machines anywhere other than in the lobby. Free wired and wifi, and portable electronics plug in and play on tv screen. Which is a 35" flatscreen. There is no inroom directory or phone book, so if you want a pizza, you have to figure that out some other way. There are two desks in the room, but only one chair. And it is shower only, no tub. There were two styrofoam cups for the coffee. There is a parking charge of $8. It is only one block from the convention center, so very easy to leave your car there and walk over. There is a place to order food. I had a breakfast sandwich, and it took a good ten minutes. There were only a few people in front of me, but the cook told me he is only allowed to make two sandwiches at a time. This was 10:00 on a Saturday. I don't know how you would ever get anything hot on a weekday at 7:30 am. Probably have to settle for bagels, cereal, or yogurt. The employees are friendly and will go out of their way to help you with anything. I didn't get a chance to see if there was a restaurant anywhere near by. But what they have there is just a simple kitchen with basic items, such as sandwiches, salads, etc.
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, location, location! Loved the historic district and the lovely walk on a busy Saturday or a night out Sunday. A walk around the town is a must! Lovely views and busy nightlife. Best for the young who only need a place to sleep. The location is small and the desk people are not the friendliest but overall a great experience. Will be back if i need to be in the downtown area. Not a homey room but a good room to sleep!
reviews.title: Not the best value but loved the location!

reviews.text: My son and I had a terrific stay here last weekend. He had a fencing tournament at the convention center, and I needed to have a couple of business meetings while he was fencing. Our "Ultra Savvy Suite" at this hotel was perfect. The hotel is just one block from the convention center, so my son was able to walk there and back on his own while I met with a colleague in the "office" of my room (a separate area with a large table).
reviews.title: perfect Convention Center hotel

reviews.text: Everyone at this hotel was super friendly, from Chris (with a great sense of humor that put us at ease instantly upon check-in) to Jesse and Justin (who efficiently confirmed my points arrangement) to the cheerful staff members who asked how the fencing went, etc., greeting us by name (a small but very nice touch). My only worry prior to booking was that there is no restaurant, but the service, quality, and selection at the snack bar was excellent and the prices were reasonable. We've booked to stay there again for next month's tournament!
reviews.title: WORST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE

reviews.text: this was a wonderful hotel in downtown Dallas ! the rooms were new, exciting , and comfy; the bar is only open in evenings and the specialty drinks were fantastic ! the bar menu is limited but good food! there is a little pre-made food bar in the morning, nothing was great there but if your in a hurry- go for it ! it is directly across from all government building , so if you have a meeting there...this is the place to stay ! what a gem for the price !!!!!
reviews.title: GREAT DEAL !

reviews.text: A hidden gem in downtown Dallas. The service was impeccable, the rooms very trendy and probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in.
reviews.title: A modern contemporary outstanding hotel with great service and amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Aloft is walking distance to most restaurants and convenient to most downtown destinations.
reviews.title: Young and chic. Excellent place to stay!!!

reviews.text: The only negative was the heating/air conditioning system in the rooms that was difficult to control. All employees were very responsive to all our needs.
reviews.title: Cool place, different
Great place to stay
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

description: The Aloft Dallas Downtown is a vibrant, loft-inspired hotel, conveniently located near City Hall, the Dallas Convention Center, American Airlines Center, and Arts District.
